column4: Headless server Xorg.log tells: (EE) No devices detected. Is it normal for headless? I can't remote X via XDMCP now...
I don't think servers have X installed?
It works before, may not work after some update ?
try the gdm debug mode, no useful info just say can't start X, using VNC instead
can you ssh into the box?
I'd look in /etc/X11/ for xorg.conf and see if there is an old/backup file, that you could overwrite xorg.conf with.
ok, what do you see if you look in /etc/X11, any gdm or xorg.conf files that could replace your current ones?
/var/log/message may have some detail information after using debug mode
could be, but log files are about as fun to read as man files.
use pastebin, don't copy and paste here, or they get upset.
ok, makes no sense to me, maybe the folks in #xorg could help you?
thx all the same, for it works before, I got no clue after debug
I can't find the Xaccess config file for gdm, not under /etc/gdm?
well, I can't help you, you are in over my head. I have a laptop with a similar problem to work on tomorrow, so who knows what is going to happen? Maybe tomorrow moring I'll have a clue?
